column1: ------------------------------- Running all benchmarks using MHInv and STrace
------------------------------- Running all benchmarks using MHInv and ObsWriter (append)
------------------------------- Running all benchmarks using MHInv and ObsWriter (prepend then reverse at end)
[-] Before using custom logPdfRaw functions instead of MWC
[+] After using custom logPdfRaw functions instead of MWC
- New benchmarks + benchmark parameters (No changes to implementation since last benchmark)
- Benchmarks after modularising PrimDist into individual data types constrained by the new Distribution type class
- Benchmarks after directly implementing sampleInv for PrimDist (rather than using MWC.Distributions)
- Benchmarks after introducing template for Accept-Reject sampling (used by MH and PMMH)
- First benchmarks for BBVI + complete benchmarks for others

- LDA: Now correctly using `take n_words (concat . repeat document)` during inference to make sure the observed data for LDA is sufficiently large. Previously the document was a fixed sized of 100 words
column2: resulting in any words after 100 being sampled for instead of conditioned on; this incorrectly caused LDA-[ ]-SMC-100 and LDA-[ ]-PMMH-50-10 to be slightly faster than it should be
column3: and LDA-[ ]-RMSMC-10-1 to be *much* faster than it should be (almost constant time).

column1: - LDA: Now benchmarking inference methods with fixed `n_words = 50` instead of `n_words = 100`
- Added arithmetic operations for DiffDistributions which operate on distributions directly rather than using `toList` and `fromList`.
- Added + using smart constructors for each Distribution type
- Dirichlet now uses length indexed vectors rather than lists
- DiffDistributions + GTraces/DTraces now use length-indexed vectors for gradients rather than lists
